title: Comparing Mixture and Mixed Effects Models for baseline exposures and longitudinal growth

yaml.title: Comparing Mixture and Mixed Effects Models for baseline exposures and longitudinal growth

markdown.markdown:
In summer 2015, I worked with Alvaro Aleman, a Williams student at the time, on comparing two statistical methods for detecting relationships between baseline exposures and longitudinal growth.

**Product** 

[Heggeseth, B. C., & Aleman, A. (2018). Early-life environmental exposures and childhood growth: A comparison of statistical methods. PloS one, 13(12), e0209321.](https://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0209321)

metadata.title: Comparing Mixture and Mixed Effects Models for baseline exposures and longitudinal growth
